edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Facts

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Facts

  • public class Facts
extends java.lang.Object
    The Fact interface provides a way for the programmer to store per-level, per-session, and per-game (persistent) information about the game. As an example, in a game of golf, one could use per-level to track the current number of strokes, use per-session to track the score across all 18 holes, and per-game to track the player's high score.

    • Method Detail

      • getLevelFact

        public static int getLevelFact(java.lang.String factName)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current level. If no such fact exists, -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putLevelFact

        public static void putLevelFact(java.lang.String factName,
                int factValue)
        Save a fact about the current level. If the factName has already been used for this level, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • getSessionFact

        public static int getSessionFact(java.lang.String factName)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current game session. If no such fact exists, -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putSessionFact

        public static void putSessionFact(java.lang.String factName,

        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved
